expandedScenes.note: SIGNIFICANT EXPANSION NEEDED - Scene currently summarizes 6 pages of dialogue (pages 111-117). Full dialogue exchange required.

expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy (OFF)
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Wendy unable to answer Jack's threatening question about Danny
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Jack moving forward, camera tracking back

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: I don't think that's true. I think you have some very definite ideas about what should be done with Danny... and I'd like to know what they are.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Interrogating, demanding Wendy reveal plan for Danny

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Well I... I think maybe he should be taken to a doctor.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Tentative, hesitant answer - fear evident in her hesitation

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: You think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: When do you think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
Wendy
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Questioning tone shows uncertainty and fear

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: You believe his health might be at stake?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: And you are concerned about him?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Building to turn question on himself

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: And are you concerned about me?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - Turning focus to himself, victimizing himself despite being the threat
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Points to himself as he moves forward

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Have you ever thought about my responsibilities?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - Beginning responsibilities rant, prioritizing hotel over family
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Moving forward, camera tracks back, points to himself and gestures

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Oh Jack, what are you talking about?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy (OFF)
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Confusion and fear at his rhetoric

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Have you ever had a single moment's thought about my responsibilities? Have you ever thought for a single solitary moment about my responsibilities to my employers?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - Abuser's rhetoric, prioritizing contract over family safety

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Has it ever occurred to you that I have agreed to look after the Overlook Hotel until May the first? Does it matter to you at all that the owners have placed their complete confidence and trust in me, and that I have signed a letter of agreement, a contract, in which I have accepted that responsibility?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - Full responsibilities rant, hotel contract paramount

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Do you have the slightest idea what a moral and ethical principal is? Do you?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack (OFF)
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Attacking Wendy's morality while threatening her life
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Wendy backing to foot of stairs

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Has it ever occurred to you what would happen to my future, if I were to fail to live up to my responsibilities?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Self-centered focus on his 'future' while threatening family

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Has it ever occurred to you? Has it?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Moving after Wendy, she's on stairs

expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: REPEATED THROUGHOUT - Defensive plea while backing up stairs

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: I just want to go back to my room.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Well... I'm very confused, and I just need a chance to think things over.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: You've had your whole fucking life to think things over - what's good a few minutes more going to do you now?
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - Dismissing her request, escalating aggression with profanity
expandedKeyDialogue.context: High angle, moving up stairs after her

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Jack... stay away from me... please.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Don't hurt me! Don't hurt me!
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: I'm not going to hurt you.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
Wendy
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Swinging bat in front of her, backing up stairs

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: Darling, light of my life, I'm not going to hurt you. You didn't let me finish my sentence. I said 'I'm not going to hurt you... I'm just going to bash your brains in!' I'm going to bash them right the fuck in.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: ICONIC LINE - Murder threat delivered with false endearments, complete psychotic break, mixing loving terms with explicit violence
expandedKeyDialogue.context: On stairs, camera tracking back, Jack laughing

expandedKeyDialogue.quote: I'm not going to hurt you.
expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Low angle, camera tracking forward as they come up stairs

expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Final demand before attempting to grab it

expandedKeyDialogue.action: JACK reaches up with hand. WENDY HITS HIS HAND WITH BAT. SHE SCREAMS. HE YELLS and grabs his wrist.
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL ACTION - First defensive strike, Wendy hits Jack's hand

expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Jack
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Pain and shock from hand being hit
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Low angle, Wendy over Jack, grabbing his wrist

expandedKeyDialogue.action: WENDY HITS JACK ON HEAD WITH BAT.
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL ACTION - Full defensive strike, knocks Jack unconscious

expandedKeyDialogue.action: JACK throws up hand and leans back. He falls backwards down stairs. Camera pans left-right with him as he somersaults down stairs, stopping face down on half landing.
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL ACTION - Jack defeated, falls unconscious down stairs

expandedKeyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
expandedKeyDialogue.significance: Shock and horror at what she's done - not triumph, but shock
expandedKeyDialogue.context: Back to camera at top of stairs, Jack lying facedown on half landing

keyActionSequences: Transition to stairs, Wendy backing up (page 114)
Extended 'Give me the bat' / 'Stay away' exchange (pages 115-117)
Wendy strikes Jack's head, he falls down stairs (page 117)
